data.name: Rhydon

data.name: Vulpix

data.flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

data.name: Potion
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

data.name: Honedge

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

data.name: Gardevoir ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psystorm
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to all Pokémon in play.

data.name: M Aerodactyl-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rock Drill Dive

data.name: Lugia

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

data.name: Shuckle

abilities.name: Pot Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shuckle by your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Ferment Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. As long as the Defending Pokémon remains Poisoned by this attack, it can't use any Poké-Body.

data.flavorText: It stores berries in its shell. The berries eventually ferment to become delicious juices.

data.name: Palkia-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lt. Surge's Secret Plan
rules: Put 1 card from your hand face down onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.) Treat that card as a Basic Pokémon as long as it's face down. Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn't a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gallade E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Gallade E4. Gallade E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Blade Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Gallade E4 LV.X from your hand onto your Active Gallade E4, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aimed Cut
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND

attacks.name: Sudden Delete

attacks.name: Time Control
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.

data.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

data.name: Energy Reset
rules: Put as many Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pikachu ★

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: N

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Focus Sash
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If the Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that Pokémon is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead. Then, discard this card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: This is an extremely rare Meowth card. Maybe good fortune will come to you if you hold this card!

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Mudbray
data.flavorText: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It's skilled at making use of mud.

data.name: Head Ringer Team Flare Hyper Gear
rules: Attach this Pokemon Tool to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon-EX that doesn't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Colorless more.
When this card is removed from a Pokémon for any reason, put this card in its owner's discard pile.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Smack ‘n' Slack

data.name: Team Plasma Badge

You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Haunt

data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

data.flavorText: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

data.name: Minion of Team Rocket
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and return it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. If 1 or both of them are tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).

data.name: Porygon-Z LV.X

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Porygon-Z LV.X from your hand onto your Active Porygon-Z, you may discard all of your opponent's Special Energy cards in play.

abilities.name: Decode
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to any 2 cards and shuffle your deck afterward. Then, put those cards on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Clefable

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

data.name: Pokémon Personality Test
rules: Put an Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses whether it is a Pokémon card with Light in its name, a Pokémon card with Dark in its name, or neither one. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 3 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 3 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

data.name: Galarian Yamask

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.

attacks.name: Heal Bell
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

This counts as Dusknoir being Knocked Out and your opponent takes a Prize card. As long as you have Dusknoir LV.X as a Stadium card in play, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon between turns. If another Stadium card comes into play or Dusknoir LV.X is discarded by the effects of any attacks, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, Trainer, or Supporter cards, return Dusknoir LV.X to your hand.

abilities.text: If Celebi Star would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, Celebi Star is not Knocked Out, discard all cards attached to Celebi Star, and put Celebi Star on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Shade
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to Celebi Star. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

data.name: Gulpin

attacks.name: Starvin'
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When Mom gets in the kitchen, the happiest things happen. I can feel my mouth watering!

data.name: Shiftry ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Skill Hack
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card you find there. Choose 1 of that Pokémon's attacks. Skill Hack copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Shiftry ex's type is still Darkness.) Shiftry ex performs that attack.

attacks.name: Dirge
attacks.text: Does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has the same name as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Plasma Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Team Plasma Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Hard Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

data.name: Rocket's Scyther ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Rocket's Scyther ex has any Grass Energy attached to it, Rocket's Scyther ex is both Grass and Darkness type.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Rocket's Scyther ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Rocket's Scyther ex can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Sprout Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
All damage done by Colorless Pokémon's attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

data.name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Nest Building
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can't get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.

data.name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

data.name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aerodactyl Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Aerodactyl-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fossil Researcher
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Amaura or Tyrunt and put them onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Steelix Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Steelix-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Gatling Peck
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.

data.name: Old Amber Aerodactyl
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Aerodactyl you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Champions Festival
rules: Once during each player's turn, if that player has 6 Pokémon in play, he or she may heal 10 damage from each of his or her Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Linoone

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

data.name: Arceus ◇
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: First Law
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trinity Star
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have Grass, Water, and Lightning Pokémon on your Bench. Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

data.name: Floette

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: During your turn (before your attack), you may put a Basic Pokémon from your hand on top of this Pokémon. (This does not count as playing that Pokémon or evolving.) This Pokémon is now that Pokémon. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

data.name: Sharpedo ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Darkness Blast
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy attached to Sharpedo ex. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: M Gallade-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Unwavering Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardevoir ex δ
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Imprison
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Gardevoir ex is your Active Pokémon, you may put an Imprison marker on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Any Pokémon that has any Imprison markers on it can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies. This power can't be used if Gardevoir ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Gardevoir ex to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Team Rocket's Evil Deeds
rules: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card there. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. Then, your opponent may draw up to 2 cards.

data.name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Dangerous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

data.name: Devoured Field
rules: The attacks of Darkness Pokémon and Dragon Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Hippowdon LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Hippowdon. Hippowdon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Sand Reset
abilities.text: Once during a game on your turn (before your attack), each player shuffles all cards in play (excluding Pokémon and Supporter cards) into his or her deck. You can't use more than 1 Sand Reset Poké-Power each game.

attacks.name: Double Shoot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon and choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Purugly

attacks.name: Nyan Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

data.name: Cofagrigus

attacks.name: Spirit Juggling
attacks.text: Discard any number of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

data.name: Palkia & Dialga LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Palkia & Dialga LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sudden Delete
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it back to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Time Control
attacks.text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Palkia & Dialga LEGEND. Add the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck to his or her Prize cards.

data.name: Bagon

attacks.name: Rock Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

data.name: Pewter City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Don't apply Resistance to any attacks made by Pokémon with Brock in their names.

data.name: Skarmory ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Metal Gravity
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats and has 40 or more remaining HP, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Metal Gravity Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Ledyba by attacks is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Jamming Net Team Flare Hyper Gear
rules: Attach this Pokemon Tool to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon-EX that doesn't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 less damage to all Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
When this card is removed from a Pokémon for any reason, put this card in its owner's discard pile.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Raichu ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mega Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu ex.

data.name: Rhyperior

attacks.name: Hefty Cannon
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

data.name: Dusk Mane Necrozma-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Meteor Tempest
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sun's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Binacle

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

data.name: Amulet Coin
rules: Attach Amulet Coin to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
If the Pokémon Amulet Coin is attached to is your Active Pokémon at the end of your turn, draw a card.

data.name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Shuppet

attacks.name: Gossip
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect unless the Attacking Pokémon is Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Arceus
rules: You may have as many of this card in your deck as you like.

attacks.name: Lightning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Arceus with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.

data.name: Doublade

attacks.name: Tool Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Pokémon Tool card attached to all Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

data.name: Broken Time-Space
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each player may evolve a Pokémon that he or she just played or evolved during that turn.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

data.name: Palkia

attacks.name: Wormhole
attacks.text: Switch Palkia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.

data.name: Double Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

data.name: Mudsdale

attacks.name: Double Impact
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 120 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale's legs sets harder than stone. It's so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

data.name: Slaking

abilities.name: Unobservant
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The world's laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

attacks.name: Entagling Thread
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Shinx
rules: Rawst Berry: If Shinx is Burned, remove the Special Condition Burned from Shinx at the end of each player's turn.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Shinx.

data.name: Jirachi

attacks.name: Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: The twinkle of the stars. The destiny of love. A miracle that grants wishes in the night sky.

data.name: Ho-Oh ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Golden Wing
abilities.text: If Ho-Oh ex would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move up to 2 Energy attached to Ho-Oh ex to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Ho-Oh ex.

data.name: Rocket's Sneasel ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Dark Ring
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Darkness Pokémon in play.

data.name: Heatran LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Heatran. Heatran LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Heat Metal
abilities.text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Burned by evolving or devolving his or her Burned Pokémon. (This also includes putting a Pokémon Level-Up card onto the Burned Pokémon.) Whenever your opponent flips a coin for the Special Condition Burned between turns, treat it as tails.

abilities.name: Heat Wave
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn, if Heatran is on your Bench, you may use this power. If you discarded basic Energy cards attached to your Fire or Metal Active Pokémon by using that Pokémon's attack this turn, attach up to 2 of those Energy cards to that Pokémon.

data.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Delcatty

attacks.name: Energy Salon
attacks.text: Search your deck for 3 different types of basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

data.name: Taillow

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

data.name: Regice ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Crystal Body
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, except damage, done to Regice ex by the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

data.name: Plasma Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

data.name: Galarian Sirfetch'd

attacks.name: Meteor Assault
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Meteor Assault again until it leaves the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.

data.name: Lugia LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Lugia LEGEND.

abilities.name: Ocean Grow
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Lugia LEGEND into play, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach all Energy cards you find there to Lugia LEGEND. Discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia LEGEND.

data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Poison Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Doduo

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Doduo does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

data.name: Fairy Drop
rules: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
